verbs.description: slayings [V: puzzle] has lots of pieces three months after a chinese family of four was killed their green bungalow sits quietly at 1846 western ave pumpkins frozen to the front porch toys in the bushes only the memorial of dead flowers and weathered teddy bears around a tree in the front yard serves as a reminder of the horrific events that happened inside an autopsy report li father shared with the world journal a chinese - language newspaper in chinatown said a knife and hammer were used causing head and facial fractures the investigation of the killings a probe led by state police has taken authorities down many avenues including into looking for links to human trafficking and asian gangs according to officials familiar with the case the homicide was so brutal it more likely that gangs did it to send a message said kyung - seok choo senior research associate at wested a nonprofit research and development agency and assistant professor of criminal justice and global studies at the university of massachusetts at lowell sources involved in the investigation said chen allegedly handled large amounts of off - the - books cash that flowed through undocumented chinese restaurant workers in a shadowy underground economy that runs from new york city to the capital region and beyond in november a flier written in chinese and english was distributed in the new york city area around the capital region and at various locations with a chinese influence asking for the public help in solving the crime university of massachusetts lowell kyung seok choo chen jin front yard state police chinatown law enforcement guilderland new york china human trafficking
